name: At the World's End (Project Orbeus)
description:
"At the World's End" is a turn-based JRPG that uses the break shield system. You start in a series of small maps which you can freely explore, equipped only with a journal containing a rough checklist of what you need to do. By exploring the areas, and inspecting items you find/purchase along the way, you will (hopefully) learn more about the world and piece together the necessary information needed to reach your main objective.

This is a short (developer run: 1 hour) - but otherwise completed - game. I am still in the process of experimenting with what I am capable of doing in this engine, so I hope you will be patient with me.

Disclaimer - This game:

1. features BGM exclusively by the brilliant YouFulca (Twitter: @YouFulcaEng);

2. is a work of fiction;

3. contains elements of religious themes, and 

4. has instances of flashing lights/patterns.

What's in the download archive(AtWorldsEnd.7z):

1. "AWE_Game" application;

2. "www" save folder;

3. "ToU.pdf" containing User Agreement statements and Credits; and 

4. "GAME_GUIDE.txt" containing useful information like hints and straight-up solutions to in-game objectives - in case anybody gets stuck =)
